SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

net.sf.appia.core.message
Class Message

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.appia.core.message.Message
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AppiaMessage
public class Message
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

This class is part of the SendableEvent and contains the information that is going to be sent through the network. It works as a stack, and people can push and pop headers into/from the message. When the message is cloned, it uses the copy-on-write method to improve performance, but this is opaque for the user.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Alexandre Pinto

offset - the offset of important data
length - the length of the data
Method Detail

setByteArray

public void setByteArray(byte[] data,
                         int offset,
                         int length)
Sets the data of the message. If the message contained some data, it is discarded.

Parameters:
data - the data to add into the message.
offset - the offset of important data
length - the length of the data

length

public int length()
Gets the length (in bytes) of the message.

Returns:
the length (in bytes) of the message.

peek

public void peek(MsgBuffer mbuf)
Peeks bytes from the message without removing it from the message.

Parameters:
mbuf - the buffer that will contain the requested data.

discard

public int discard(int length)
Discards the first length bytes of the message.

Parameters:
length - the number of bytes to discard.
Returns:
the remaining number of bytes in the message.

discardAll

public void discardAll()
Discards all message contents.
Although equals to "discard(length())" it is faster. Notice that if a MemoryManager is being used in a Channel, all stored messages must be empty when they are no longer needed.

pop

public void pop(MsgBuffer mbuf)
Pops a header from the message and puts the data into the MessageBuffer. The number of bytes poped could be different from the nunber of bytes requested. This method has the same semantics as a receive() when using TCP.

Parameters:
mbuf - the MessageBuffer to store the poped data.

push

public void push(MsgBuffer mbuf)
Push a header into the message.

Parameters:
mbuf - the data to push into the message.

truncate

public int truncate(int newLength)
Truncates the message to newLength bytes, removing the last bytes of the message.

Parameters:
newLength - the new length of the message.
Returns:
the number of bytes removed from the message.

frag

public void frag(Message m,
                 int length)
Fragments the message. The current message keeps the first length bytes and the remaing bytes are moved to the message m.

Parameters:
m - the message where to add the first length bytes.
length - the number of bytes to move.

join

public void join(Message m)
Joins two messages, adding message m to the end of the current message.

Parameters:
m - the message to join with the current message.

toByteArray

public byte[] toByteArray()
Gets a byte array version of the message.

Returns:
a byte array containing the message.

getMsgWalk

public MsgWalk getMsgWalk()
Gets a MessageWalk object, which is used to travel through the message blocks.

Returns:
a new instance of MessageWalk object.

clone

public java.lang.Object clone()
                       throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
Clones the message. It just adds one more reference to the blocks. The message it self is only cloned if needed. It is used copy-on-write.

Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object
Throws:
java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException

popReadOnly

public void popReadOnly(MsgBuffer mbuf)
Pops the requested number of bytes without copying these bytes. This method should be used only when the message is shared and the user don't want to modify the requested data. This method was created for performance reasons.

Parameters:
mbuf - the MessageBuffer to store the requested data.

peekReadOnly

public void peekReadOnly(MsgBuffer mbuf)
Peeks the requested number of bytes without copying these bytes. This method should be used only when the message is shared and the user don't want to modify the requested data. This method was created for performance reasons.

Parameters:
mbuf - the MessageBuffer to store the requested data.

getMsgWalkReadOnly

public MsgWalk getMsgWalkReadOnly()
Gets a MessageWalk object, which is used to travel through the message blocks. This method should be used only when the message is shared and the user don't want to modify the requested data. This method was created for performance reasons.

Returns:
a new instance of MessageWalk object.

getMemoryManager

public MemoryManager getMemoryManager()
Gets the current memory manager associated to this message.

Returns:
the current memory manager, or null if there are no memory manager.

setMemoryManager

public void setMemoryManager(MemoryManager newMM)
Changes the current memory manager of this message. Changes the quota of the message.

Parameters:
newMM - the new memory manager
Throws:
AppiaOutOfMemory - runtime exception

unBind

public void unBind(int nBytes)
Unbinds an amount of memory in the current memory manager.

Parameters:
nBytes - number of bytes to free.

bind

public void bind(int nBytes)
Bind a amount of bytes in a Memory Manager.

Parameters:
nBytes - number of bytes to reserve.
Throws:
runtime - Exception AppiaOutOfMemory.

pushObject

public void pushObject(java.lang.Object obj)
Push an Object (header) into the head of the message.
The Object must implement the Serializable interface. Otherwise a MessageException is raised.

Parameters:
obj - the Object (header) to put in the message
See Also:
MessageException

Push an long into the head of the message.

Parameters:

pushUnsignedInt

public void pushUnsignedInt(long ui)
Push an unsigned int into the head of the message.

Parameters:
ui - the value to put in the message, only the lowest 32 bits are considered.
See Also:
MessageException

pushUnsignedShort

public void pushUnsignedShort(int us)
Push an unsigned short into the head of the message.

Parameters:
us - the value to put in the message, only the lowest 16 bits are considered
See Also:
MessageException

Push a byte into the head of the message.

Parameters:
b - the value to put in the message
See Also:
MessageException

pushUnsignedByte

public void pushUnsignedByte(int ub)
Push a unsigned byte into the head of the message.

Parameters:
ub - the value to put in the message, only the lowest 8 bits are considered.
See Also:
MessageException

pushString

public void pushString(java.lang.String str)
Pushes the given string into the message.
The string is coded with UTF-8. The implementation is based on DataOutputStream class.

Parameters:
str - The string to push into the message.
See Also:
DataOutputStream

popObject

public java.lang.Object popObject()
Pops a Object from the message.
Throws MessageException if the message is empty or there isn't an Object at the head of the message.

Returns:
the value at the head of the message
See Also:
MessageException

popString

public java.lang.String popString()
Pops a string from the message.
The string is coded with UTF-8. The implementation is based on DataInputStream class.

Returns:
the string removed from the message

peekObject

public java.lang.Object peekObject()
Returns the Object from the head of the message, without removing it.
Throws MessageException if the message is empty or there isn't a Object at the head of the message.

Returns:
the value at the head of the message
See Also:
MessageException
